data.title: A nice peaceful stay
data.text: Not the newest, but clean and cosy. Its seem like they are renovating which would improve the place for sure but all in all i enjoyed my 3 days here. The staff were helpful and cheerful and the price was right.

data.title: It's good for ONE thing
data.text: And you know what I'm talking about.  It's out of the way.  It's not a filth-pot, but it's not even near Motel 6 standards either.  Sure there's only a swamp-cooler, but it works fine because those coolers do great with DRY heat, and that's the kind you get in Apple Valley.

data.title: You get what you pay for and here it isn't much of anything
data.text:
I wasn't expecting much because of the price but this place was far worse than my already low expectations.
Made a reservation online but the front desk manager couldn't find it. It was his first day.
It was below 40 and no heat in the room so I was moved to another room where the heat worked for about 10 square feet. Cold air leaked through the poorly sealed windows.
I ended up sleeping on the floor because when I checked the bed I found old tissues and crumbs that had never been cleaned from previous guests. Very disgusting.
I know that many hotels and motels, when they receive poor reviews, the manager will apologize and write comments of their own. Not the case here. THEY OBVIOUSLY DON'T CARE BECAUSE YOU GET LESS THAN WHAT YOU PAY FOR HERE.

data.title: OVER CHARGED
data.text: i came to this place because it was close to my husband's grandmother's house and we were visitng with her while he was visitng from NC. first off their website says their rooms are 40 bucks a night but when u get here they charge you 52 bucks a night. just like all the other reviews this place is ran down...out dated swamp cooler in the window..busted wall heater. cheap towels and they only leave one in your room. i dont even spend time in the room if i dont have to, just to sleep get up and get out. i will never stay here again...really wish i could have seen these reviews before i wasted my money!!!

data.title: No Air Conditioning- Only Swamp Cooler! Unbelievably bad.
data.text:
I had to run up to Apple Valley for business and did not have time to research reasonably priced motels. I generally have good luck with the modestly priced establishments- primarily because I am not looking for nor willing to pay for 400 thread-count Egyptian cotton sheets, pillow-top mattresses and fancy flat-screen TV's. Not that you could hope to find that in the high desert at all. 
Anyway, I'm going to cut to the chase. The rooms ARE NOT AIR CONDITIONED! Yes, they have "swamp coolers"... which DO NOT WORK DURING THE SUPER-HUMID MONSOON SEASON!! Swampers work by flowing water over filters which then evaporates and the thus- cooled air is blown in by (noisy) fan. They work pretty good when the humidity is low, but during the July thru September Monsoon season are, at best, minimally effective. The end result is that you feel sticky and hot. Bottom line: NOT ACCEPTABLE. 
The rest of the room is just, well, OLD. Curtains consist of hemmed bedsheets. Mattress firm and not real comfortable. Bedspread and carpet acceptably clean but worn. WiFi worked with my Mac Book Pro but my iPhone 4s  (which I know needs a stronger signal) would not connect. Beware re "non-smoking " rooms. Mine was non-smoking yet had definitely been smoked in -ALOT. Think about it: Do you think they are gonna be truthful about this- and let $50 or more fly away to another establishment.
Ahh well, you get what you pay for, right? Well in Apple Valley- not so much. It's too close to LA. 
Bottom Line? : For about $5-10 extra per night you can get a much better room. I paid $105 for two nights- and that was with my "contractor discount". I would have to say that this is, no doubt, the cheapest motel in town. It might be OK in the winter as it has a newer-looking Williams wall heater. But forget it for the summer. 
BTW, yep I BARBECUED this place. If the rooms were cheaper- and they HAD BEEN UP-FRONT ABOUT THE LACK OF AC, well ummm this is 2012. WHAT MOTELS DO NOT HAVE ACTUAL AIR CONDITIONING?!?!?!?!?

data.title: Room 21- High Desert Disaster
data.text:
I am compelled to write a review because this definitely is the worst motel room I’ve encountered in the past forty–five years of traveling. Due to uncontrollable, last-minute changes in medical and caregiver schedules of family we were visiting in Lucerne Valley, my sister was unable to cancel our reservation less than 48 hours prior to check in. The Black Horse management is not flexible or accommodating re: cancellation. There was no negotiating, like paying for one night and getting refund for the second night. Credit card payment was upfront for both nights on the website.  
I wonder what room was photographed for the website. It definitely wasn’t Room 21. This is the room that I review.
The front desk man on duty (March 22) was not friendly. He questioned me as to why I was asking for two additional sets of towels. That was a first! The main source of heat is a wall-heater and the pilot light was off. Cold air from the high-desert night leaked through the top & bottom of door so my sister stuffed her comforter in the gaping cracks and for the 2nd night we borrowed a blanket from our aunt. A round table was pushed into a dark corner of main room with no lighting for reading, visiting with my sister. When we checked in, another guest’s fishing pole, crutches, and soiled clothing were inside the closet. The dead bolt was broken. The 'guy' was so surly that we chose not to 'bother' him w/maintenance issues. We asked for another room and our request was denied.
The carpet & furniture was soiled and in need of repair or replacement; broken bathroom mirror; unwashed & dirty film on windows; refrigerator and microwave unplugged; stove pilot light was off; kitchen tiles chipped; dirty tin foil under stove grates; scratchy blankets; rough & scratchy towels; thin sheets; major air leakage at top and bottom of door; small, non-lighted tiled shower with peeling non-skid strips. The 'double' room was indeed one double bed and one twin bed pushed against the wall directly under the window. This was not stated on website. The wooden bed frames were permanent and immovable. Coffee was not available--the man at front desk stated that since the room was only $50.00 per night that coffee was not offered. 
I highly recommend NOT staying at Black Horse Motel, at least not in Room 21, unless cleanliness and security are not an issue. 
During past travels, I have located older, cleaner and decent lodging for $60 and under. My expectation is always the same, that the room & bedding are clean and doors/windows are secure, that management is pleasant and accommodating. Not so during our 2-night stay. Truly, there are NO redeeming qualities re: the room for me to be positive about. The high desert sunrise was magnificent. Our first impression of the room was not that of charming or quaint --more like broken down, dilapidated, uncared for, unsecure. With no refund available, my sister and I stayed. 

Stayed March 2010
(aka khandra)

data.title: WHAT A DUMP!!!YOU NEED A FULL BODY CONDOM!!! GROSS!!!! OLD!!! RUNDOWN!!! WASTE OF MONEY!!! SLEEP IN YOUR CAR!!!
data.text: Omg!should of called the health department!!! I hope we did not catch aids,herpes,or ANY other sexually transmitted disease!!! !!

data.title: Nice Little Place
data.text: I Love this place, it is one block from the main hwy  so you avoid all the noise, the price is cheap at $45 a night. Rooms are not like the Hilton so if you are looking for something like that then don't come here, out bathroom shower was newly tiled, and room came with a full kitchen. Overall i would stay here again.

data.title: LOVE THIS PLACE
data.text: Those fools who wrote negative reviews on this place have obviously unreal expectations.  It's a inexpensive quant quiet motel located away from all the hussle bussle of the main drag.  I don't understand what they're complaining about.  You can clearly see from the outside that it's an older establishment, did they expect that it would suddenly become renovated on the inside for the cheap $50 bucks a night?  The guy complaining about not getting enough towels that's stupid.  How many towels do you need anyway?  We had 5 in our room. Hey man!  it is such a cool experience to finally get a place that has real character.  The cheezy furnishing, carpet and the buildings archetecture all add to it's flavor.  Think Bate's motel, think Quentin Tarantino 60-70s style.  THen you will really appreciate the place more.  It appears to be a family run business.  Our check in girl was very nice and helpful.  She asked if we would like to examine the room before commiting to staying and we did.  My friend and I both loved the place and thought it was a pleasant switch from all the nights we've been staying in Super 8 and Motel 6 places.  The rooms are huge.  Our's had a full sized kitchen with dinning table, full sized fridge, stove, oven, microwave, sink.  Our bathroom was old but the shower tiles were brand new.  Water was good and hot.  Our room had a wall heater that you twist a knob to turn on or off.  We had a T.V. with cable.  The place was so quiet we slept the best of all nights.  I guess you have to love uniqueness to appreciate this kind of style of place that so stands out from all those other places that just look and feel the same.

data.title: Disgusting, find another motel
data.text:
I am compelled to write a review because this definitely is the worst motel room I’ve encountered in the past forty –five years of traveling. Due to changes in medical and caregiver schedules of family we were visiting, we could not cancel this room. Note that Black Horse management is not flexible or accommodating. One cannot cancel a reservation less than 48 hours in advance. 
I wonder what room was photographed for their website advertising. It definitely wasn’t Room 21. 
The front desk person on March 22 was not friendly. He questioned me as to why I was asking for two additional sets of towels. The main source of heat is wall-heater and the pilot light was off. Cold air from the high-desert night leaked through the top & bottom of door. The round table was pushed into a dark corner of room with no lighting available for reading, forcing us to sit on the beds near the only lamp. When we checked in, another guest’s belongings were inside the closet. The dead bolt was broken. 
The carpet & furniture was soiled, broken bathroom mirror; unwashed & dirty film on windows; refrigerator and microwave unplugged; stove pilot light was off; kitchen tiles chipped; dirty tin foil under stove grates; scratchy blankets; rough & scratchy towels; thin sheets; major air leakage at top and bottom of door; small, dark tiled shower with peeling non-skid strips; no coffee. When begging for the extra towels, I asked if coffee was available in the morning, and the man stated that since the room was only $50.00 per night that coffee was not offered. 
I highly suggest NOT staying at Black Horse Motel unless you like flushing money down the toilet. In the past I have located older, cleaner and decent motels for $60 and under. Not this one. Truly, there are NO redeeming qualities about the Black Horse. It is not charming or quaint. Adjectives that come to mind are dirty, dark, derelict, deteriorated, despicable, dingy, depressing, disgusting, deplorable.

data.title: Never never never stay here
data.text: Wow, what a dump.  Old, dirty, delapilated, no heat, no amenities, had to beg for more towels, dead bolt was broken, bathroom mirror broken glass, one table lamp was the only light source, thin icky blankets, large opening at the bottom of the door and smaller one at the top of the door that we had to stuff to keep cold air out. Dirty items found in the closet at check in.  There is not one redeeming quality for this place. Trust me.  DO NOT STAY HERE.  I am not a snob, but this is certainly the very worse place I have stayed in in my entire 57 years.

data.title: I would rather sleep in my car!
data.text: First of all I don't ever take the time to write reviews so the fact that I chose to write one about this place speaks for itself. I was unbelievably mortified when I saw the inside. I know what your thinking if it was that bad why did you stay there...well my boyfriend picked it and had already paid. So we were stuck because these people dnt even give you a refund even if you just paid and are unsatisfied with the condition of the room. When you walk in the smell alone is enough to make you want to leave. We tried to champ it out even with how disgusting the stains were on the bed, carpet, ect. Anyway we couldn't help feeling like we were about to be the plot of a bad horror movie so we left and paid for a room somewhere else. Please do not believe any positive reviews on this place for I believe they were all written by managment/owners. Don't stay here...do not do it!
